history.text: plus! @dennisdunn 0/1
See Patient Profile edit view for comments on edit mode behavior.

The story has been renamed to reflect that the critical action is the addition of a new patient record. The Intake Screener should exercise due diligence in search first for a match before simply adding what could be a duplicate record, but the essential action has less to do with the Patient Queue and more to do with initial details of the patient.

This is the "edit" view for patient information. Clicking a button will load the patient info into an editor, clicking another button with save or discard the changes. We should take a look at how other mobile apps handle this. Data binding updates the view model and a command on the view model does the save. We have to figure out how to navigate from a read-only view to an edit view and back again.

history.text:
@dennisdunn There are some events that require re-forecasting: additions/deletions in immunization history, changing certain key details of past immunizations (date, vaccine delivered), and the passage of time (like rotavirus no longer being needed after a given age-8 mos.).

In all other cases, once a forecast has been calculated, it is "good all day" and can be passed around.

The Schedule Vaccination list is updated as the result of a forecast. The results should be persisted so that other users don't need to run the forecast. We need to simply bind the view model and the updates will happen.

history.text: plus! @dennisdunn 0/1

Form factor may affect implementation as to whether we use a modal popup. Phones, for instance, may not be well-suited for a completely new popup; they may be handled in other ways, like a sliding panel.

For MVP purposes, we are assuming it works on a phone. This will necessitate research into phone-friendly metaphors in the chosen framework, such as sliding panels. (Dennis - "copy Facebook")

Interesting concepts:

* Date entry (HTML5 should help here - input type="date"?)
* Conditional list lookup (Vaccine Group --> Lot #'s)
* Dialog/slide-out panel handling

These should be solved once and then propagated consistently.
plus! 0/1

Given that we have the dialog and the list of available vaccines then clicking the OK button will add the selected vaccine to the patient, persist the choice, update the view model, and trigger a forecast.
This needs a vaccine/lot lookup list.

history.text:
A "pill" is a representation of an item from a list.  The user selects an item, such as a card, by dragging the item to a container. A pill is created in the container to represent the item allowing a more compact representation of a list of selections. A pill is almost like an avatar or badges icon.

Hth,
D.
@dennisdunn I found this: http://www.gumbyframework.com/docs/ui-kit/#!/tabs for the mention of "pills" in user interface, specifically "pill tabs". Am I on the right track?

history.text: plus! 0/3

Appointment modeling, including the source of the appointment (auto-generated vs. manual override), the person scheduling the appointment, etc. will be needed. The appointment will be overridable/editable, even after the suggestion provided by the scheduling projection.

The ability to enter the next appointment date based on the suggested CDSi-derived date will be necessary so that the patient can obtain proper follow-up care and notification (ex: SMS to parent's cell phone).

This is not yet reflected in the current wireframes.
